intro: Cuphea wrightii var. wrightii, commonly known as the Wright's cuphea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular red or orange flowers that attract hummingbirds and bees. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped, opposite leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, sandy or loamy soils. Cuphea wrightii var. wrightii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
